0.Pros: You get paid, but not much.
0.Cons: Very low pay honestly not worth it.

1.Pros: Lots of support and help. Lots of opportunities for advancement. Lots of resources and connections.
1.Cons: Kind of boring and monotonous. Wish they gave more free food to employees

2.Pros: A lot of hours provided due to high turnover rate.
2.Cons: Low pay, management was often rude to employees, worked 10 hour shifts with no breaks

3.Pros: There aren't many. It's a good part time job while still in school and you get a discount on food.
3.Cons: Quick turnover of employees, inconsistent breaks, rude management, higher expectations in drive thru than what is achievable

4.Pros: Free food when you get a break
4.Cons: Long hours on your feet,rude customers

5.Pros: Fast paced atmosphere and fun people
5.Cons: Minimum wage, but it is a low skill job

6.Pros: The amazing relationship I had between my coworkers and upper management. This job has set a path for a lot of us out there and I wouldn't take a second back.
6.Cons: They do not try to develop or train the crew/management with detail. Everything is about numbers and speed. Detail is everything

7.Pros: It's easy to get an interview and get hired to start working.

8.Cons: Can't sit down. Sometimes you don't get a break, even if you're working a 9 hour shift. Managers are snobby. Physically exhausting. Only get about $500 a month.

9.Pros: good benefits for a starting job, nice discount/ free food, descent starting wages, good management
